intro: Inga disticha, commonly known as the "Cupuaçu" tree, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon Basin. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces a sticky, sweet pulp that is rich in nutrients and has a unique flavor. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and typically yellow or greenish in color. Inga disticha thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
